Sentencas: Symmetrical solid oxide cells (SSOCs) have recently gained significant attention for their potential in energy conversion due to their simplified cell configuration, cost-effectiveness, and excellent reversibility.
Titulo: Enhancing the Electrochemical Performance in Symmetrical Solid Oxide Cells through Nanoengineered Redox-Stable Electrodes with Exsolved Nanoparticles

Sentencas: However, previous research efforts have mainly focused on improving the electrode performance of perovskite-type electrodes through different doping strategies, neglecting microstructural optimization.
Titulo: Enhancing the Electrochemical Performance in Symmetrical Solid Oxide Cells through Nanoengineered Redox-Stable Electrodes with Exsolved Nanoparticles

Sentencas: This work presents novel approaches for the nanostructural tailoring of (La0.8Sr0.2)(0.95)Fe1-xTixO3-delta (LSFTx, x = 0.2 and 0.4) electrodes using a single-step spray-pyrolysis deposition process.
Titulo: Enhancing the Electrochemical Performance in Symmetrical Solid Oxide Cells through Nanoengineered Redox-Stable Electrodes with Exsolved Nanoparticles

Sentencas: By incorporating these electrodes into a Ce0.9Gd0.1O1.95 (CGO) porous backbone or employing a nanocomposite architecture with nanoscale particle size, we achieved significant improvements in the polarization resistance (R-p) compared with traditional screen-printed electrodes.
Titulo: Enhancing the Electrochemical Performance in Symmetrical Solid Oxide Cells through Nanoengineered Redox-Stable Electrodes with Exsolved Nanoparticles

Sentencas: To further boost the fuel oxidation performance, a Ni-doping strategy, coupled with meticulous microstructural optimization, was implemented.
Titulo: Enhancing the Electrochemical Performance in Symmetrical Solid Oxide Cells through Nanoengineered Redox-Stable Electrodes with Exsolved Nanoparticles

Sentencas: The exsolution of Ni nanoparticles under reducing conditions resulted in remarkable R-p values as low as 0.34 and 0.11 Omega cm(2) in air and wet H-2 at 700 degrees C, respectively.
Titulo: Enhancing the Electrochemical Performance in Symmetrical Solid Oxide Cells through Nanoengineered Redox-Stable Electrodes with Exsolved Nanoparticles

Sentencas: Moreover, an electrolyte-supported cell with symmetrical electrodes demonstrated a stable maximum power density of 617 mW cm(-2) at 800 degrees C. These findings highlight the importance of combining electrode composition optimization with advanced morphology control in the design of highly efficient and durable SSOCs.
Titulo: Enhancing the Electrochemical Performance in Symmetrical Solid Oxide Cells through Nanoengineered Redox-Stable Electrodes with Exsolved Nanoparticles
